alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 1:31PM EDT until April 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch, sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch and ice accumulations around two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Slippery roads could be possible after sunset tonight and last until 8 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions after sunset tonight. Even light ice amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to slick roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute on untreated roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will drop below freezing after sunset tonight, no travel impacts are expected until tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
